content.label: I am excited for the next one!

I would give this game 5 stars, and it deserves it, if not for one thing. I opened the game one day, and it said to choose one file to overwrite. I didn’t even click anything, and there was no exit button, and I had no choice but delete a file I worked really hard on, and beat the game on, and all kinds of things. PLEASE FIX THIS! I am ok with it now, but if it does this again, which it will and has, I don’t know what I will do. Otherwise, this is a great game, and I actually liked it better than Cat Quest 1, and so you should definitely get it, just be careful and patient, because it may delete your progress. Now, this might just be me, and in that case I will be annoying, but I’ll live. If you can fix it though, please do. I love the entire cat quest series, and it is terrible when it breaks or something like that. Please make more games like this, and if you have, tell me. THANK YOU.

title.label: One of the best games on Apple Arcade

content.label:
This is truly the ultimutt RPG, Period. Players will be purring with delight because of the great music, good combat, and deep storyline. Overall a must play for anyone with a Apple Arcade subscription and a taste for RPGs about cats.

🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈
This game is a perfect mix of story and adventure, showing it in the cute form of cats and puns! Ignore the other bad reviews! There’s always some negativity!

I absolutely hate the control system. You can’t add the option of a D pad for those who don’t like the general way of moving the cat around? It’s a shame to, because the graphics and art style are great. So is the gameplay. I’ll add more stars if we ever get a digital D pad.

title.label: Great game, but is there a bug forum?

content.label:
Hi. Devs, if you’re reading this, do you know where I could find a bug forum to report bugs on? Because I think I accidentally found a big one. XD Just in case there’s not a bug forum, I’ll post it here.

I was using Old Master Body for my melee character, the cat. And although it is supposed to lower my max hp, it actually raised it... to 2,147,483,647. I’m pretty sure this is not supposed to happen, as healing at a save stone pretty much makes me unkillable with this much hp. I’m on an iPad 6th generation, latest iPadOS update. I have completed the game but still have a few side quests to finish up. I’ve played the epilogue once, and completed the game practically just before the update.

So the game isn’t very long it took me less than 2 days to beat so for me it had good story and stuff you don’t really have to do much other than story because most story quests and stuff give you most the stuff you need so no real grinding only maybe a few Dungeons and stuff and the story quests will get you far enough to beat it and also if/when cat quest comes out that will probably be cool and overall it’s a good game!
More: I’m still playing and it does have allot of stuff like lonely cave: which has a level 200 hedgehog thing and some armor and a sword which is nothing I guess? It’s cool and I’m planning to try and get everything

I am a roleplay, and cat lover. When I saw cat quest (The first one), I was disappointed that It cost money. A while later, Arcade came out and I got it. I was extremely excited to see cat quest II. I downloaded it, and found out, you can use a Xbox controller. The gameplay is amazing, with a beautiful landscape. Warning: the game is addicting 😂
I recommend this game for anybody bored in quarantine.

It’s like there no input programmed for the game to recognize the 2nd controller. We’d love to try to play this, but until this is fixed, it doesn’t seem like we’ll be able to.

But now when Igor to one of the main quests I had gotten half way and then exited the game and when I came back it made me restart it. Ok that’s fine I got to where I was and finished that quest. BUT NOW I just opened it and I had gotten to the first kings quest and had died so I was doing side quests to up my characters and level up and I had done a couple dungeons and now I’m back at the start of the first Kong’s quest again. So  it deleted all my progress of my side quests that I had done earlier today and that’s just really bad for me cuz they took me a while. My rating will change when this games save options will, maybe a button to be able to save it manually or something

I don’t write to many reviews but this game I had to. There were a couple things I would have changed. You are kind of lost as to what armor weapon and type of magic to use. I also thought it would be better to have been able to zoom in and out while gameplay. But this was a fun simple game to play.

It’s a fun game. Took about 12-15 hrs of play time over 3 days to complete though. Therefore it’s rather short. Game is straight forward, the controls on the touch screen are easy to master. I like the Easter eggs in the game, although I know I didn’t find everything. I wish there was a way to place a marker on the map or even a way to check the caves and towers that aren’t found.  Or even a way to zoom out to see the entire map. It would make them easier to find. (I am playing on iPhone 8 Plus so maybe in iPad it’s better.)   Overall it’s a fun game.

Lots of nice Easter eggs and plenty of puns, with fun combat mechanics

title.label: I love the reference in this game

content.label: I recently discovered that they referenced Nathan Drake from the Uncharted series. It appears as a side quest to help find some treasure and when I saw that was his name I absolutely loved it. If only they added a Victor Sullivan. Other than that, the game is very well made and has beautiful graphics. It can also be challenging but it makes even more fun if you start a mission 10 levels higher than what you have. Although I would like a map.

I play it so much because it is so fun I am at level 500 (because I’m a pro gamer) it is like the only game I play. I have one question through. In cat quest 3 where there be a new kingdom like rabbits or bear or bird or whatever? Either you answer or not (hopefully yes) this game is amazing! I normal just play 3D but this beat all of them, and I have a lot of games. Can’t wait for cat quest 3, bye!
This game is soooooo cool 😎.i beat it and the ending was heartbreaking! I’m just waiting until the next one comes out.i found out it came out a few months ago so get start on the next one Now!
Yeet

This game is simply incredible. It’s challenging, but not in a bad way- and the characters are adorable! Anyways, I’m going to list pros and cons

PROS:
-Beautiful art style!!! Simple, yet amazing!
-Adorable characters! Love the idea of a world of cats and dogs!
-Funny Jokes! There is some humor in the game-which I love- but just enough to where the game is still serious 
-Never crashes (for me, at least. I’m not sure about other players)
-SAVES PROGRESS! That is a HUGE deal, since I feel like a lot of the Arcade games don’t.
-Just really addictive! 
-Fun to play- I don’t really get stuck that much
I’m sure there’s more, but I’ve listed A LOT

CONS (is there even any?)
-Sometimes the places you have to go have harder enemies, but there’s no way to level up your armor or strength. (I’m not sure if that’s just me missing something though)
-The maps are huge, and sometimes it’s really hard to find where you need to go.

Like I said though, not many cons!

This is my absolute FAVORITE Arcade game, and I would get arcade just for this game. (Well, that and Guildlings)

Five stars FOR SURE, since this is a long adventure game that’s hard to get bored of!

-KiwitheTuber

title.label: Controls are done in the least optimal way

content.label: Controls are super jank, first the dodge roll is a double tap in the direction you want to go, and attack is just tapping the enemy you want to attack, what this means is in tight spaces or where there are multiple enemies you can’t dodge in the direction you want. Additionally to move you have to tap where on the screen you would like to go or hold your finger on the spot to continuously move in that direction, this is extremely annoying as you have to use both hands all the time to properly reach across the screen, and it is annoying/boring just tapping and waiting. A touch joy stick type deal that is commonly used in these kinds of games would be much better, then you could double tap while moving to roll in whatever direction easily and can move more fluidly in combat or roam with one hand. Also the spell selection controls could be optimized better as well. I’m not really surprised by poor optimization, basically all apple arcade games feel rushed.

This game is very fun and an amazing sequel to the first Cat Quest. This game has all the fun quests and quirky secrets you'd expect from the first one, and more. The wands and companion are fun, however they make this game extremely easy. I can beat bosses that are much higher level than me by slowly whittling their HP from afar and dodging the easy-to-avoid projectiles and attacks. And if I do get hit, I can just get the dog to revive me. But maybe the gameplay seems too easy because I played the first game too much. Also, this game has some plot issues. For example, it doesn't seem to explain why Kit Kat is still around. And you can fight dragons even though you aren’t ‘dragonblood’ which is weird, and I think for some reason what is supposed to make ‘dragonbloods’ unique now is that they can make friends with the dragons or something. Either way that kind of makes the plot of the first game feel wrong, because turns out ‘dragonbloods’ aren't so special. They removed the spooky island, the icy area, and the dragon-tree place although that doesn't really matter because they wouldn't have played a substantial role in the story, but it would have been fun to do new quests in them. Speaking of quests, they are even more interesting, fun and diverse than ever. Some of them are pretty surprising. However, my biggest shock with this game is that they didn't continue the Queen's Resort story. I was REEEALLY looking forward to seeing where THAT was going, and I'm a bit sad it went nowhere. I'm excited for Cat Quest 3, but hopefully the developers add a few more quests and gamemodes into this game before then. Also, I love the character design. The cat looks cuter and slightly less dopey, as with many of the others, and Mr. Rocky is the absolute best. I don't even know how you came up with something so beautiful. Aside from that, they ruined the dragons by giving them legs. After all the other GREAT changes they made, I have NO IDEA what made them think giving the dragons LEGS was a good idea. They used to look so cute and now they look weird and scary. Also I think I'm the only person who cares so whatever. Oh, and Troll Cave was disappointing, but honestly, what did I expect?

Right, I forgot to mention: I love Kirry and he/she is even cuter than the one from the first game, but Kirry doesn't follow you around and doesn't accompany you for side quests, which makes it feel a tad lonely unlike the first game where Spirri would always have weird commentary on everything and accompany you every step of the way.

This is the first time I ever write a review for a game or any app in the App Store. I’ve passed over this game so many times thinking it may not be for me. Man, was I wrong. This game is PURR-FECTION. I love the interactions and puns and creative story. Playing Co-op makes it so much more enjoyable as well. I definitely recommend playing this game. Great job!

My wife and I play the co-op on the Apple TV with two Xbox controllers, and we love it! It’s very intuitive but also provides enough of a challenge to require some good teamwork.

Cat Quest 2 is a well designed game with good controls, a fun story, tones of ruffrences, and more puns the my review! The world is purrty large with a lot to do so it never feels empty. Every turn there is a new dungeon, quest, chest, or a 3 round arena. You get weapons, armor, and spells and you can mix and match with both characters to make your purrfect duo of catdog. You should download this game meow and have a blast! This definitely a must have game, just don’t ruff up the messenger, he did nothing wrong (you will know when you meet him)
